title.value: Identification of Acute Myeloid Leukemia Cell Surface Therapeutic Targets Using Single Cell RNA Sequencing Supported By Surface Proteomics
title.justification: The title is explicitly mentioned at the beginning of the abstract.
title.quote: Identification of Acute Myeloid Leukemia Cell Surface Therapeutic Targets Using Single Cell RNA Sequencing Supported By Surface Proteomics

extractions.description: The paper focuses on identifying potential therapeutic targets for Acute Myeloid Leukemia (AML) by analyzing the expression landscape of surface proteins in immature leukemic cells using single-cell RNA sequencing and surface proteomics.

type.justification: The paper involves experimental analysis using techniques like single-cell RNA sequencing, Random Forest classifier, and surface proteomics to identify cell surface targets.
type.quote: To identify the expression landscape of surface proteins in immature leukemic cells, we performed single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq, 10x 3’ Reagent Kits) of primary human AML cells from 20 specimens.

name.justification: The research is centered on identifying therapeutic targets for Acute Myeloid Leukemia (AML).
name.quote: Acute myeloid leukemia (AML) comprises diverse genomic subgroups and remains hard to treat in most patients.

name.justification: The study uses single-cell RNA sequencing as a primary method for analysis.
name.quote: To identify the expression landscape of surface proteins in immature leukemic cells, we performed single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq, 10x 3’ Reagent Kits).

name.justification: The research also involves surface proteomics for validating surface protein expression.
name.quote: To validate surface expression, we concomitantly analyzed the surface proteome.

name.justification: The model is specifically mentioned as being developed and used for classifying AML cells.
name.quote: A Random Forest classifier was developed to unbiasedly classify AML cells into distinct differentiation stages using normal bone marrow-derived scRNA-seq data from the Human Cell Atlas (HCA) consortium.

is_contributed.justification: The model was developed by the authors for this research study.
is_contributed.quote: A Random Forest classifier was developed to unbiasedly classify AML cells.

is_executed.justification: The model was executed to classify AML cells into distinct differentiation stages.
is_executed.quote: We trained a Random Forest classifier to annotate cells in a two step process.

is_compared.justification: The model was evaluated using accuracy metrics, but there is no mention of comparison with other models.
is_compared.quote: We performed a five-fold cross validation of the model and subsequently determined the accuracy of our classifier to be 92% on the test subset of the HCA data.

referenced_paper_title.value: Not explicitly mentioned in the paper
referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper does not reference any other paper regarding the development or use of the Random Forest classifier.
referenced_paper_title.quote: A Random Forest classifier was developed to unbiasedly classify AML cells into distinct differentiation stages.

name.justification: The dataset used for single-cell RNA sequencing of primary human AML cells is from the Leucegene cohort.
name.quote: single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq, 10x 3’ Reagent Kits) of primary human AML cells from 20 specimens of the Leucegene cohort.

referenced_paper_title.value: Not explicitly mentioned in the paper
referenced_paper_title.justification: The dataset is mentioned as part of their methodology but no specific paper is referenced.
referenced_paper_title.quote: primary human AML cells from 20 specimens of the Leucegene cohort.

name.justification: The data from the Human Cell Atlas was used to develop and train the Random Forest classifier.
name.quote: A Random Forest classifier was developed to biasedly classify AML cells into distinct differentiation stages using normal bone marrow-derived scRNA-seq data from the Human Cell Atlas (HCA) consortium.

referenced_paper_title.value: Not explicitly mentioned in the paper
referenced_paper_title.justification: The dataset is utilized within the research but no specific paper is referenced.
referenced_paper_title.quote: using normal bone marrow-derived scRNA-seq data from the Human Cell Atlas (HCA) consortium.
